com.ducksonflame.dynablaster

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.ducksonflame.dynablaster.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Board
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Main game JPanel - core of the game. Available TILE_SIZE's: 50, 100 - in order to add support for other sizes, add appropriate image sizes (only even TILE.SIZE's). The Board contains several finals that can be modified (currently only via source code modifications) in order to mod the game settings.

    Settings that can be modified:

    MOVEMENT_ERROR_MARGIN - Tolerance for player movement collision. Allows for non-pixelperfect movement. (default is 50).
    TILE_SIZE - Size of a Tile in pixels. (for 1080p screens and below suggested is 50, for higher res screens - 100).
    NUMBER_OF_FREE_COLUMNS - Number of columns (default is 8).
    NUMBER_OF_FREE_ROWS - Number of rows (default is 6).
    GAP_WIDTH - Size of the gap between left/right edges and the outside walls. Only cosmetics. (Default and recommended is TILE_SIZE)
    INITIAL_MAX_BOMBS - Initial maximum number of bombs that can be placed by a player (default is 1).
    INITIAL_RANGE - Initial range of explosions for players (default is 2).
    INITIAL_CHAR_TIMER_SPEED - Initial interval for updating player's position. The lower the higher speed. Intended, non-linear progression.
    SPAWN_RATE - Dictates how many Destructible Walls are created (default and suggested is 0.9). 1 means all eligible tiles are filled (except for 2 adjecent to both players' position).
    POWER_UP_RATE - Sets rate at which powerUps are created after destroying walls (default is 0.2).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • initUI

        public void initUI(MyFrame jF)
        Parameters:
        jF - takes parent JFrame reference Initializing the UI Adding the KeyListener Adding Dimensions (it probably should not be the Dimension class I know...) for DestrWalls to use Setting the refresh rate to 60fps and 60Hz check rate for explosions (e.g. if player walks into one) Initializing the Explosions Set (The size of this JPanel automatically scales to the chosen TILE_SIZE and columns/rows number)

      • newExplosion

        public void newExplosion(int x,
                         int y,
                         int range)
        Parameters:
        x - Takes the x position of the exploding bomb
        y - Takes the y position of the exploding bomb
        range - Takes the player's range Method should only be invoked by exploding bombs. Note that the player's range is taken from the bomb not directly from the player. This means the range of the explosion is taken from the moment of bomb placement and is not affected by later rangeUp pickups.

      • endExplosion

        public void endExplosion()
        Pauses the refresh timer and gets rid of the explosion. In case of Exceptions the method is set to call itself again. There is currently a bug where if 3+ explosions chain together, one may remain on the map. Looking for a proper fix.

      • explosionCheck

        public void explosionCheck()
        Method invoked at refresh rate. Checks whether the explosion touches a Player, DestrWall, Bomb or PowerUp. If yes, invokes the kill/explode/setNull method from target.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Main paint method. Invokes methods for paintable objects. First draws the Floor. Last draws are Characters and Explosions.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context

      • drawBombs

        public void drawBombs(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws bombs. Animations are handled by the Bomb class.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context

      • drawExplosions

        public void drawExplosions(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws Explosions. Contains advanced logic for drawing explosions in range of other explosions. 4 for loops for each Explosion are invoked to check all directions. Checks for explosions being null.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context

        x - Position x
        y - Position y

      • powerUpPickUp

        public void powerUpPickUp(int i,
                          int j)
        Called by Character instance. Collision checked in the Character class. Sets the PowerUp as null after pickup.
        Parameters:
        i - Index i for identification of proper instance.
        j - Index j for identification of proper instance.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Keybindings. WSAD/Directional arrows for Player 1/2 movement. G/Enter for Player 1/2 bomb placement. For movement - booleans control movement (set true on press, set false on release). Coded with booleans for smooth movement.
        Special key - SPACE - clears map of explosions. Used for debugging. Should be removed for final release.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Sets booleans false on movement key release. See keyPressed documentation for further information.
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • endGame

        public void endGame(int playerNo)
        Ends the game on player kill. Currently no logic for draws (win for player 2). Invokes the playAgain method of the JFrame and passs the winner information.
        Parameters:
        playerNo - Takes killed player number to determine who won.

      • stopTimer

        public void stopTimer()
        Stops repaint and explosionCheck mehtods. Used by other classes to get access to the explosion set.

      • getPowerUps

        public PowerUp[][] getPowerUps()

      • leftCheck

        public void leftCheck()
        Checks whether the explosion has collided with anything on the left. Invokes respective kill methods. Used by the explosionCheck method.

      • downCheck

        public void downCheck()
        Checks whether the explosion has collided with anything down. Invokes respective kill methods. Used by the explosionCheck method.

      • upCheck

        public void upCheck()

      • rightCheck

        public void rightCheck()
        Checks whether the explosion has collided with anything on the right. Invokes respective kill methods. Used by the explosionCheck method.
